com.viaoa.util

Class OACompare

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.viaoa.util.OACompare

  • public class OACompare
extends java.lang.Object
    Used to compare objects, even if objects are different classes. Ex: String "1234" will equal double 1234.00 ex: boolean true will equal any number but 0, any value except null, any string except '' blank Also allows for comparing with Hub or Array to another Hub/Array, or single object (hub.AO or hub[0]&size=1, array.length=1&array[0])
    Author:
    vvia

      • compare

        public static int compare(java.lang.Object value,
                          java.lang.Object matchValue,
                          int decimalPlaces)
        Compare objects, converting them (using OAConverter class) if necessary. Coercion Rules will use the following for converting values before comparing: check if array type if check if Hub type value, matchValue can be any type of object, including Hub or Array. value, matchValue do not have to be same class.

      • isNotEmpty

      • isEmpty

        public static boolean isEmpty(java.lang.Object obj)

      • isEmpty

        public static boolean isEmpty(java.lang.Object obj,
                              boolean bTrim)
        Checks to see if the value of an object can be considered empty. example: null, an empty array, an collection with no elements, a primitive set to 0, primitive boolean that is false, a string with only spaces (if using bTrim)
        Parameters:
        obj -
        bTrim - if true and object is a string, then spaces will be ignored.

        public static void main(java.lang.String[] args)
